meanings.definition: The quality or condition of being servile.
meanings.sent1: Her servility was evident in the way she always put others' needs before her own.
meanings.sent2: The king demanded servility from his subjects, expecting them to obey his every command without question.
meanings.sent3: The servility of the dog towards its owner was so extreme that it would even fetch the newspaper every morning.
meanings.sent4: The servility of the politician towards the wealthy elite was likened to a puppet on strings, dancing to their every whim.
meanings.sent5: The servility of the robot to its human master was programmed into its very core, ensuring unwavering obedience.

meanings.definition: An excessive willingness to serve or please others.
meanings.sent1: His servility towards his boss knew no bounds, as he would go to great lengths to fulfill every request.
meanings.sent2: The waitress's servility towards the customers was so extreme that she would even apologize for things beyond her control.
meanings.sent3: The servility of the cat towards its owner was comical, as it would bring gifts of dead mice as tokens of affection.
meanings.sent4: The servility of the employee towards the demanding manager was like a never-ending cycle of submission and approval-seeking.
meanings.sent5: The servility of the loyal dog towards its master was unmatched, as it would wag its tail eagerly at every command.
